question: [File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-release-builder/src/components/randomness_config.rs] [Struct: ReleaseFriendlyRandomnessConfig] [Input validation] Can an attacker create a V1 or V2 config with secrecy_threshold_in_percentage set to 0, potentially breaking the threshold-based security guarantees of the distributed key generation and allowing single validators to reconstruct randomness secrets?
